info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 07 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 600 PM MONDAY UNTIL 900 AM TUESDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Archuleta and southern Hinsdale Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Piedra and Arboles. WHEN...600 PM Monday August 07 to 900 AM Tuesday August 08 IMPACTS...The Bear Creek and Dry Lake wildfires will impact southern Hinsdale and western Archuleta counties through at least early Tuesday morning. Moderate to heavy smoke from these fires will drain from Weminuche Creek in southern Hinsdale County southward overnight into the Piedra area, and could continue down the Piedra River as far south as Arboles by early Tuesday morning. Additionally, the Quartz Ridge wildfire in eastern Archuleta County could produce moderate to heavy smoke for locations along East Fork Road westward to Highway 160 north of Pagosa Springs. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
